intro: Geissois ternata var. serrata, commonly known as the serrated geissois, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
